meanings.sent1: The police found a hidden stash of moonshine in the forest.
meanings.sent2: In the old days, people would make moonshine in secret to sell.
meanings.sent3: The party guests were surprised when the punch turned out to be moonshine!
meanings.sent4: The moonshine flowed like a river at the underground bar.
meanings.sent5: The smell of moonshine lingered in the air, making everyone curious.

meanings.sent1: Some people still moonshine in remote areas to avoid detection.
meanings.sent2: Back in the day, many would moonshine to make extra money.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to moonshine for a special occasion, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: He moonshined a batch of liquor that was so strong, it knocked him out.
meanings.sent5: Moonshining requires skill and secrecy to avoid getting caught by the authorities.

meanings.definition: Adjective: Shining or glowing softly, like the moon
meanings.sent1: The moonshine glow of the fireflies lit up the night.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had a beautiful moonshine shimmer under the lights.
meanings.sent3: The room had a cozy moonshine ambiance with dim lighting.
meanings.sent4: The lake reflected the moonshine sky, creating a magical scene.
meanings.sent5: The moonshine stars twinkled in the clear night sky, mesmerizing all who looked up.
